  14. (**************************************************************************)

  16. external format_int : string -> int -> string = "caml_format_int"

  18. ‌let err_no_pred = "U+0000 has no predecessor"
  19. ‌let err_no_succ = "U+10FFFF has no successor"
  20. ‌let err_not_sv i = format_int "%X" i ^ " is not an Unicode scalar value"
  21. ‌let err_not_latin1 u = "U+" ^ format_int "%04X" u ^ " is not a latin1 character"

  23. ‌type t = int

  25. ‌let min = 0x0000
  26. ‌let max = 0x10FFFF
  27. ‌let lo_bound = 0xD7FF
  28. ‌let hi_bound = 0xE000

  30. ‌let bom = 0xFEFF
  31. ‌let rep = 0xFFFD

  33. ‌let succ u =
  34.   if u = lo_bound then hi_bound else
  35.   if u = max then invalid_arg err_no_succ else
  36.   u + 1

  38. ‌let pred u =
  39.   if u = hi_bound then lo_bound else
  40.   if u = min then invalid_arg err_no_pred else
  41.   u - 1

  43. ‌let is_valid i = (min <= i && i <= lo_bound) || (hi_bound <= i && i <= max)
  44. ‌let of_int i = if is_valid i then i else invalid_arg (err_not_sv i)
  45. external unsafe_of_int : int -> t = "%identity"
  46. external to_int : t -> int = "%identity"

  48. ‌let is_char u = u < 256
  49. ‌let of_char c = Char.code c
  50. ‌let to_char u =
  51.   if u > 255 then invalid_arg (err_not_latin1 u) else
  52.   Char.unsafe_chr u

  54. ‌let unsafe_to_char = Char.unsafe_chr

  56. ‌let equal : int -> int -> bool = ( = )
  57. ‌let compare : int -> int -> int = Stdlib.compare
  58. ‌let hash = to_int

  60. (* UTF codecs tools *)

  62. ‌type utf_decode = int
  63. (* This is an int [0xDUUUUUU] decomposed as follows:
  64.    - [D] is four bits for decode information, the highest bit is set if the
  65.      decode is valid. The three lower bits indicate the number of elements
  66.      from the source that were consumed by the decode.
  67.    - [UUUUUU] is the decoded Unicode character or the Unicode replacement
  68.      character U+FFFD if for invalid decodes. *)

  70. ‌let valid_bit = 27
  71. ‌let decode_bits = 24

  73. let[@inline] utf_decode_is_valid d = (d lsr valid_bit) = 1
  74. let[@inline] utf_decode_length d = (d lsr decode_bits) land 0b111
  75. let[@inline] utf_decode_uchar d = unsafe_of_int (d land 0xFFFFFF)
  76. let[@inline] utf_decode n u = ((8 lor n) lsl decode_bits) lor (to_int u)
  77. let[@inline] utf_decode_invalid n = (n lsl decode_bits) lor rep

  79. ‌let utf_8_byte_length u = match to_int u with
  80. | u when u < 0 -> assert false
  81. | u when u <= 0x007F -> 1
  82. | u when u <= 0x07FF -> 2
  83. | u when u <= 0xFFFF -> 3
  84. | u when u <= 0x10FFFF -> 4
  85. | _ -> assert false

  87. ‌let utf_16_byte_length u = match to_int u with
  88. | u when u < 0 -> assert false
  89. | u when u <= 0xFFFF -> 2
  90. | u when u <= 0x10FFFF -> 4
  91. | _ -> assert false
